Class GuiColorHelper

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.helpers.GuiColorHelper
public class GuiColorHelper extends Object
Helper class for color and styling logic extracted from GuiController. Contains exact same code, just moved to separate file.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GuiColorHelper(GameMode currentMode)
    Creates a new color helper for the specified game mode.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiColorHelper

      public GuiColorHelper(GameMode currentMode)
      Creates a new color helper for the specified game mode.
      Parameters:
      currentMode - the current game mode (affects color rendering)

  • Method Details

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver(boolean gameOver)
      Sets whether the game is over. When true, blocks become visible even in Invisible mode.
      Parameters:
      gameOver - true if game is over, false otherwise

    • getFillColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint getFillColor(int value)
      Gets the base fill color for a given value.
      Parameters:
      value - the color code (0-7)
      Returns:
      the paint color for the value

    • applyDimFactor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint applyDimFactor(javafx.scene.paint.Paint base, double factor)
      Applies a dimming factor to a color.
      Parameters:
      base - the base color to dim
      factor - the dimming factor (0.0-1.0)
      Returns:
      the dimmed color

    • getActiveBrickFillColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint getActiveBrickFillColor(int value)
      Gets the color for the currently falling brick (always full brightness).
      Parameters:
      value - the color code (0-7)
      Returns:
      the paint color for the active brick

    • getBackgroundFillColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint getBackgroundFillColor(int value)
      Colour for settled blocks in the background. Classic / Survival / Rush-40: landed blocks are drawn with normal colours. Hyper/Invisible: landed blocks are fully transparent during gameplay; they still exist in the matrix for collision / line clear, but visually "merge into" the empty background. When game is over, all blocks become visible even in Invisible mode.
      Parameters:
      value - the color code (0-7)
      Returns:
      the paint color for the background

    • setRectangleData

      public void setRectangleData(int colorCode, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Draw a single cell of the active falling layer (no background).
      Parameters:
      colorCode - the color code (0-7)
      rectangle - the rectangle to style

    • setBackgroundRectangleData

      public void setBackgroundRectangleData(int colorCode, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Draw a single cell of the background matrix.
      Parameters:
      colorCode - the color code (0-7)
      rectangle - the rectangle to style

    • setGhostRectangleData

      public void setGhostRectangleData(int colorCode, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Draw a single cell of the ghost/shadow layer. Uses semi-transparent fill with an outline to make it visually distinct.
      Parameters:
      colorCode - the color code (0-7)
      rectangle - the rectangle to style

    • setCurrentMode

      public void setCurrentMode(GameMode mode)
